title: What is the difference between "physical" and "metaphysical" reality and how can we understand it?
first_phrase: In this last part (200 tokens) of the text, the author discusses the concept of "metaphysical" and how it relates to the physical body and consciousness. The author explains that while the physical body experiences space and time, the metaphysical experience is not bound by these conditions. The text also explores the difficulty in understanding metaphysical experiences and how initiation can lead to its realization. It is important to note that initiation is likened to the process of death but voluntarily undertaken with the aim of preserving consciousness.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the notion of metaphysical reality may be difficult to grasp for those limited to bodily experiences, initiation into such states can be achieved through a deliberate and active process. Additionally, it's important to note that space and time are not inherent components of reality and that our limited experiences should not be the sole basis for understanding the world around us.
